intro: Humboltia grandiflora, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes罂粟 (opium poppy) and other related species. Humboltia grandiflora thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in coastal regions. It plays an important role in local ecosystems and is also cultivated for its ornamental value.
